oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Unilateral Castration in Bulls: 20 Cases (1989-1999)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ivany, Jennifer
Anderson, David E.
Monke, Donald
Ayers, William
Hull, Bruce L.
Frazer, Grant
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: productivity
pasture breeding
unilateral castration
post-operative complication
breeding soundness
semen production
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Surprisingly little data is available regarding productivity of bulls following unilateral castration. Heath et al (1996) published a study on 8 bulls which demonstrated a productive return to pasture breeding after unilateral castrations. The purpose of this retrospective study was to review a large number of bulls with unilateral castration to describe techniques used, post-operative complications and return to semen production or breeding soundness.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2000; 154-155
